parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To stumble, fall, sin, err, transgress. A form of pipto; to trip, i.e. to err, sin, fail.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Involved in, held in, hence: liable, generally with dat. (or gen.) of the punishment. From enecho; liable to.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
